intro: Senecio matatini, commonly known as the Matatini groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Senecio matatini is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
